page.title: 08Transport Near Springfield
page.content: The main St.Andrews to Edinburgh{road, the A91 passes near Springfield.The main{railway}line from Dundee to Edinburgh passes through Springfield, where passengers can board or leave the train.Diesel engines are used to pull the trains. A Cupar to Glenrothes{bus service} passes through Springfield three times a day.Children over 12 years of age are taken by bus to Bell Baxter High School in Cupar. People going to work travel by car, bicycle, motorbike, bus, train, van, or walk.A survey of traffic on 7th May 1985 on the A91 showed 120 cars and 48 lorries passed per hour.
